name: Giant Fan
text: {2}, {T}: Move target counter from one card to another. If the second card's rules text refers to any type of counters, the moved counter becomes one of those counters. Otherwise, it becomes a +1/+1 counter.

editions.flavor: Only a villain would unleash a giant fan on anyone!

name: Giant Growth
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins

editions.flavor:
"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

—Isperia's Edict, provision VII.789.2

name: Giant Harbinger
text: When Giant Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Giant card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

name: Giant Mantis
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor:
"I hate insects of every sort. The only mercy is that they are generally small."
—Mwani, Mtenda goatherd

"I hate insects of every sort. The only mercy is that they are generally small."
—Mwani, Mtenda goatherd
"I always thought the great insects of Tazeem were frightening until I saw the Eldrazi. Now I welcome the sight of mantises perched in the treetops."—Ryza, Oran-Rief scout

"Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea, trans. Lewis
At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.
The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

name: Giant Oyster
text:
You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap step.
{T}: For as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, target tapped creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step, and at the beginning of each of your draw steps, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. When Giant Oyster leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, remove all -1/-1 counters from the creature.

name: Giant Scorpion
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.
Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.
Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.

name: Giant Shark
text:
Giant Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Whenever Giant Shark blocks or becomes blocked by a creature that has been dealt damage this turn, Giant Shark gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Giant Shark.

name: Giant's Ire
text: Giant's Ire deals 4 damage to target player. If you control a Giant, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The only feeling greater than hurling something a mile is crushing something else with it that was really, really irritating you.

name: Giant Slug
text: {5}: At the beginning of your next upkeep, choose a basic land type. Giant Slug gains landwalk of the chosen type until the end of that turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

name: Giant Solifuge
text:
({R/G} can be paid with either {R} or {G}.)
Trample; haste; shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor:
"We respect all lifeforms, but this one we respect from a distance."
—Mandor, Selesnya ranger

"If you'd ever met one, you wouldn't ask me to justify the extra provisions for additional security."
—Lorref, caravan master

name: Giant Spectacle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace.

editions.flavor: The giant-decorating contest at the migration festival is a tradition that may have started as a dare.

name: Giant Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"
It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.
While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.

"It has a quickness about it that seems unnatural for its large size, yet its hunger is about right."
—Endril, Kalonian naturalist
While it possesses potent venom, the giant spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

name: Giant Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

editions.flavor:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
Measure for Measure
"Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"

To use it like a giant."

editions.flavor: "The turtle lives 'twixt plated decks/ Which practically conceal its sex./ I think it clever of the turtle/ In such a fix to be so fertile." —Ogden Nash, "The Turtle"

name: Giant Warthog
text: Trample

editions.flavor:
"When the Ancestor saw the cruelty her human children were capable of, Her fury shook the world. From this outburst sprang the warthogs."
—Nomad myth

name: Gibbering Descent
text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 1 life and discards a card.
Hellbent — Skip your upkeep step if you have no cards in hand.
Madness {2}{B}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Gibbering Fiend
text:
When Gibbering Fiend enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, Gibbering Fiend deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Gibbering Hyenas
text: Gibbering Hyenas can't block black creatures.

editions.flavor:
Hyenas laughing—what's the joke?
—Femeref phrase meaning
"that's not funny"

name: Gibbering Kami
text:
Flying
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Gideon, Ally of Zendikar
text:
+1: Until end of turn, Gideon, Ally of Zendikar becomes a 5/5 Human Soldier Ally creature with indestructible that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.
0: Create a 2/2 white Knight Ally creature token.
−4: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+1."

name: Gideon, Battle-Forged
text:
+2: Up to one target creature an opponent controls attacks Gideon, Battle-Forged during its controller's next turn if able.
+1: Until your next turn, target creature gains indestructible. Untap that creature.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon, Battle-Forged becomes a 4/4 Human Soldier creature with indestructible that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.

name: Gideon, Champion of Justice
text:
+1: Put a loyalty counter on Gideon, Champion of Justice for each creature target opponent controls.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon, Champion of Justice becomes a Human Soldier creature with power and toughness each equal to the number of loyalty counters on him and gains indestructible. He's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.
−15: Exile all other permanents.

name: Gideon Jura
text:
+2: During target opponent's next turn, creatures that player controls attack Gideon Jura if able.
−2: Destroy target tapped creature.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon Jura becomes a 6/6 Human Soldier creature that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.

name: Gideon's Avenger
text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a +1/+1 counter on Gideon's Avenger.

editions.flavor: "The good don't sit and wait for the evil to act. They prepare to defend. They prepare to punish."

name: Gideon's Lawkeeper
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: "The essence of a lawful society is swift deterrence."

name: Gideon's Phalanx
text:
Create four 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.

name: Gideon's Reproach
text: Gideon's Reproach deals 4 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: "Suddenly, Gideon was there with us, clearing the way so that we could escape."—The War Diaries

name: Gifted Aetherborn
text: Deathtouch, lifelink

editions.flavor: A few aetherborn have discovered a way to sustain their own existences at the cost of an insatiable hunger for the life essence of other beings.

name: Gift of Estates
text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Gift of Granite
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.

editions.flavor: The blessing adds both protection to the recipient and weightlessness to the stone.

name: Gift of Immortality
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. Return Gift of Immortality to the battlefield attached to that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying and lifelink.

editions.flavor:
"Remember by whose gift you ascend."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Gift of the Deity
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and all creatures able to block it do so.

name: Gift of the Gargantuan
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card and/or a land card from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Gift of the Woods
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn and you gain 1 life.

name: Gift of Tusks
text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a green Elephant with base power and toughness 3/3.

editions.flavor: It's an experience you'll never forget.

name: Gifts Given
text: Search target opponent's library for four cards with different names and reveal them. That player chooses two of those cards. Put the chosen cards into the player's graveyard and the rest into your hand. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: "Thanks! You shouldn't have."

name: Gifts Ungiven
text: Search your library for up to four cards with different names and reveal them. Target opponent chooses two of those cards. Put the chosen cards into your graveyard and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

text: {1}: Target creature you control has base power and toughness 7/7 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "All life is driven by an indomitable will to survive. I simply turn that into something more . . . tangible."

Flying

text:

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: Do the glowing trinkets show it the way home, or do they set a twisted path for someone else to follow?

name: Gilt-Leaf Ambush
text: Create two 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens. Clash with an opponent. If you win, those creatures gain deathtouch until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

name: Gilt-Leaf Archdruid
text:
Whenever you cast a Druid spell, you may draw a card.
Tap seven untapped Druids you control: Gain control of all lands target player controls.

editions.flavor: "In our hands, the natural world finds more beauty than nature alone could ever provide."

name: Gilt-Leaf Palace
text:
As Gilt-Leaf Palace enters the battlefield, you may reveal an Elf card from your hand. If you don't, Gilt-Leaf Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Dawn's Light, greatest palace of Gilt-Leaf Wood, is built on tiers of wood and power.

name: Gilt-Leaf Seer
text: {G}, {T}: Look at the top two cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Destroy target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.

editions.flavor: "To trespass so far from home is to ask for a lonesome grave."

Flying, first strike

If a source would deal damage to you or a permanent you control, prevent half that damage, rounded up.

name: Gix

Even while overseeing many of Phyrexia's most important undertakings, Gix continues his own quest for supremacy . . . for in Phyrexia, the weak become fodder for the strong.

text: Morph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor:
"Have you spent a winter high in the mountains, where the ice walks and speaks to the wind? It is not a place for those who have not learned respect."
—Ulnok, Temur shaman

name: Glacial Wall
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

editions.flavor:
"Huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"As we neared, Belfar proclaimed the wall to be made of glass and went forward to prove it. We had no choice but to pull his hands free from where he had touched it, leaving flesh palmprints on the icy wall."
—Tross, Vainus Expedition leader

Like arguing with ice
—Vodalian expression meaning
"wasting your time"

"There is no confusion as to the boundary of the archmage's territory."
—Ippin, master cartographer

"We are farther west than any could have imagined possible, but I still wish to press on. Unfortunately, huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Glassdust Hulk
text:
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Glassdust Hulk gets +1/+1 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
Cycling {W/U} ({W/U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Glasses of Urza
text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

editions.flavor: Izzet artificers have learned to steer their beautiful constructs clear of Boros warhammers—and the opera house.

name: Glaze Fiend
text:
Flying
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Glaze Fiend gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Before the zealots of the Ethersworn came to power, Esper illusionists dreamed up creations to mimic a variety of substances.

name: Gleam of Authority
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each +1/+1 counter on other creatures you control.
Enchanted creature has vigilance and "{W}, {T}: Bolster 1." (To bolster 1, choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Gleam of Battle
text: Whenever a creature you control attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: Every soldier returns from battle changed: by hardship, by blood, by a glimpse of glory.

name: Gleam of Resistance
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+2 until end of turn. Untap those creatures.
Basic landcycling {1}{W} ({1}{W}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Gleancrawler
text:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Trample
At the beginning of your end step, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

name: Gleeful Sabotage
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Conspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Gleemax
text: You choose all targets for all spells and abilities.

editions.flavor: Help us . . . R&D under mental domination of alien brain in jar . . . only chance . . . Gleemax's blatant disregard for flavor text . . . send help

name: Glen Elendra
text:
At end of combat, you may exchange control of target creature you control that dealt combat damage to a player this combat and target creature that player controls.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, gain control of target creature you own.

name: Glen Elendra Archmage
text:
Flying
{U}, Sacrifice Glen Elendra Archmage: Counter target noncreature spell.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
